inventory.balloonMinHint: Proxmox can reclaim unused memory down to this minimum value.

inventory.unlockHint: Run this command on the Proxmox node:

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Account settings
settings.onboardingMessage: To start using ProxCenter, please add at least one connection to a Proxmox VE or PBS server.
settings.licenseManagement: Manage your ProxCenter license to access advanced features.
settings.ollamaDescription: Ollama allows running LLMs locally. No data is sent externally.
settings.openAiWarning: Requests will be sent to OpenAI servers. Make sure this complies with your security policies.
settings.anthropicWarning: Requests will be sent to Anthropic servers. Make sure this complies with your security policies.
settings.greenConfigDescription: Configure settings for calculating environmental impact and energy costs of your infrastructure.
settings.co2FactorExplanation: The emission factor varies by country's energy mix. France (nuclear) emits ~10x less COâ‚‚ than Poland (coal).
settings.serverSpecsDescription: These settings help estimate the power consumption of your infrastructure.
settings.defaultPbsPort: Default PBS port: 8007 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.defaultPvePort: Default PVE port: 8006 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.ifDifferentFromApi: If different from API URL (e.g., via reverse proxy)
settings.appearanceDesc: Customize the overall appearance of ProxCenter. Changes are saved automatically.
settings.systemModeDesc: "System" mode automatically adapts to your OS preferences.
settings.backgroundTintDesc: Adjust the background color to reduce eye strain
settings.visualStyleDesc: Choose a global design that transforms the appearance of the entire interface
settings.uiScaleDesc: Adjust the overall interface size (ideal for high-resolution screens)
settings.blurIntensityDesc: Adjust the blur effect of transparent elements
settings.semiDarkMenuDesc: Keeps the menu in dark mode even in light theme
settings.pbsPortInfo: Default PBS port: 8007 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.pvePortInfo: Default PVE port: 8006 - Use an API Token with appropriate permissions
settings.webInterfaceUrlHelper: If different from API URL (e.g., via reverse proxy)
settings.confirmDeactivateLicense: Are you sure you want to deactivate your license?
settings.aiConfigDescription: Configure the AI assistant to interact with your infrastructure using natural language.
settings.enableAiAssistantDesc: Allows interacting with ProxCenter using natural language
settings.ollamaInfo: Ollama allows running LLMs locally. No data is sent externally.
settings.pueDescriptionFull:
PUE = Total datacenter energy / IT energy
Includes cooling, lighting, UPS, etc.
settings.electricityPriceHelper: Average price excl. tax from your provider
settings.co2FactorExplanationFull: The emission factor varies by country's energy mix. France (nuclear) emits ~10x less COâ‚‚ than Poland (coal).
settings.serverSpecsDescriptionFull: These settings help estimate the power consumption of your infrastructure.
settings.avgCoresHelper: To estimate the number of servers
settings.generalTabInfo: This section will be enhanced soon with customization options.
settings.sshInfo: SSH access enables advanced features that are not available through the Proxmox API.
settings.sshKeyHint: Paste your SSH private key (OpenSSH format)
settings.sshKeyConfiguredHint: An SSH key is already configured. Leave empty to keep it.
settings.sshPassphraseHint: If your key is protected by a passphrase
settings.sshPasswordWarning: SSH key authentication is recommended for better security.

profilePage.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters

rbac.title: RBAC

network.title: Network Security
network.rulesEvaluatedTopBottom: Rules are evaluated from top to bottom. Drag and drop rows to reorder.
network.enableFirewallOnNic: To enable firewall on an interface, edit the VM network configuration in the Hardware tab.
network.addSecurityGroupOrRule: Add a Security Group or a direct rule
network.securityGroupRulesApplied: The Security Group {name} rules will be applied to this VM.
network.activateFirewall: Enable firewall to protect your infrastructure.
network.switchToDropZeroTrust: Switch to DROP for a Zero Trust model.
network.infrastructureZeroTrustCompliant: Your infrastructure follows Zero Trust principles.
network.selectConnectionMicroseg: Select a connection to view microsegmentation
network.securityGroupsClusterFeature: Security Groups are a Proxmox cluster feature. In standalone mode, firewall rules must be configured directly at the host or VM/CT level.
network.aliasesDescription: Define names for your networks and IPs
network.vmCtRulesDescription: Configure rules directly on each machine
network.clusterRulesDescription: Cluster rules apply to the entire Proxmox infrastructure.

microseg.title: Micro-segmentation
microseg.subtitle: Zero Trust intra-VLAN isolation
microseg.clickVmToIsolate: Click on a VM to see impact and enable isolation
microseg.gatewayAliasesDesc: For each network net-xxx, an alias gw-xxx points to the gateway ({offset}). This allows traffic to/from the network gateway.
microseg.securityGroupsBaseDesc: Each sg-base-xxx contains 4 rules: allow gateway IN/OUT, block VLAN IN/OUT. This isolates VMs from each other within the same VLAN.
microseg.vmApplicationDesc: Apply sg-base-xxx to each VM, then add business Security Groups (sg-dmz-web, sg-mgmt...) for allowed flows.

configDialog.title: Micro-segmentation Configuration
configDialog.gatewayAddressDesc: Defines the IP offset used for gateways in each network.
configDialog.excludedNetworksDesc: Networks containing these keywords will be excluded from micro-segmentation (Ceph, Corosync, etc.).
configDialog.showExcludedInList: Show excluded networks in the list
configDialog.autoCreateGwAliasesDesc: Creates an alias for each network without gateway
configDialog.autoCreateBaseSGsDesc: Creates a base Security Group for each network

generateDialog.title: Generate micro-segmentation configuration
generateDialog.info: This action will create missing gateway aliases and base Security Groups.
generateDialog.allConfigured: All application networks are already configured!
generateDialog.gwCreationDisabled: Gateway alias creation is disabled. {count} alias(es) will not be created.
generateDialog.noActions: No actions needed - configuration is already complete.

siteRecovery.title: Site Recovery
siteRecovery.subtitle: Ceph RBD cross-cluster replication & disaster recovery

dashboard.rpoComplianceDesc: Percentage of jobs meeting their RPO target
dashboard.noSitesConfigured: No replication sites configured. Add cluster connections with Ceph to get started.

protection.noJobsDesc: Create a replication job to start protecting your VMs with Ceph RBD mirroring.
protection.noJobFoundDesc: Modify your filters or create a new replication job.
protection.selectJob: Select a job to view details.

plans.noPlansDesc: Create a recovery plan to define failover procedures for your protected VMs.
plans.selectPlan: Select a plan to view details.

createJob.title: Create Replication Job
createJob.noTags: No tags found on source VMs
createJob.onlineModeDesc: Replicate while VM is running (may impact performance)
createJob.sshChecking: Checking direct SSH connectivity between clusters...
createJob.sshSuccess: Direct SSH connection verified between {source} and {target}
createJob.sshRequirement: Passwordless SSH must be configured between source and target clusters. Ensure root can SSH from source to target without a password prompt.
createJob.vmidPrefixHelp: Prefix added to VM IDs on the target cluster (e.g. prefix 9 + VM 100 = 9100). Leave empty or 0 to keep the same VMID.

failover.testDescription: This will perform a non-destructive test failover. VMs will be started on the DR site without affecting the primary site.
failover.failoverDescription: WARNING: This will failover all VMs in this plan to the DR site. The primary site VMs will be stopped.
failover.failbackDescription: WARNING: This will failback all VMs to the primary site. DR site VMs will be stopped and data will be synchronized.

emergencyDR.title: Emergency DR
emergencyDR.noVMsDesc: Configure replication jobs to enable emergency disaster recovery.
emergencyDR.failbackNoPlan: Failback unavailable â€” VM is not part of a recovery plan

console.title: Console
console.checkVmStarted: Make sure the VM is started

vmIsolation.title: VMs
vmIsolation.name: Name
vmIsolation.selectInterface: Select at least one interface to isolate
vmIsolation.vmIsolatedSuccess: VM {name} isolated in {level} mode ({count} SG applied)
vmIsolation.selectInterfaceWarning: Select at least one interface to enable isolation
vmIsolation.standardDesc: IN = DROP, OUT = ACCEPT â€” Blocks inbound traffic, allows all outbound
vmIsolation.reinforcedDesc: IN = DROP, OUT = DROP â€” Only gateway allowed (strict Zero Trust)
vmIsolation.affectedVmsInfo: These VMs will no longer be able to communicate directly. Create business Security Groups to authorize flows.

vmConfig.title: VM Configuration
vmConfig.restartWarning: Some changes require a VM restart to take effect.
vmConfig.name: Name
vmConfig.cpuLimitHelper: 0 = no limit. Limits VM CPU usage.
vmConfig.cpuTypeHelper: "host" for best performance, "kvm64" for migration compatibility
vmConfig.cpuUnitsHelper: Relative CPU priority (default: 1024). Higher = more priority.
vmConfig.balloonHelper: 0 = ballooning disabled. Allows reclaiming unused memory.
vmConfig.balloonInfo: The VM can use between {min} MB and {max} MB of RAM as needed.
vmConfig.memorySharesHelper: Memory allocation priority in case of contention (0-50000)
vmConfig.disksNotImplemented: Disk modification is not yet implemented in this interface. Use the Proxmox interface to manage disks.
vmConfig.biosHelper: OVMF required for Windows 11 and Secure Boot
vmConfig.machineTypeHelper: Q35 recommended for modern VMs and PCIe passthrough
vmConfig.qemuAgentHelper: Enables better integration with Proxmox (clean shutdown, freeze, etc.)
vmConfig.advancedArgsWarning: Manual modification for advanced users only.

hardware.confirmDeleteDisk: Are you sure you want to delete disk {id}?
hardware.confirmDeleteNetwork: Are you sure you want to delete interface {id}?
hardware.moveDiskTo: Move disk to another storage. Current storage: {storage}
hardware.localDiskMigration: Migration with local disk - may take a while
hardware.sharedStorageInfo: Your disks are on shared storage ({storages}). They will remain accessible from all nodes without data copy.
hardware.selectSharedStorageTip: Select a shared storage to migrate your local disks and avoid future copies.
hardware.vmStoppedColdMigration: The VM is stopped. It will be migrated cold (faster).
hardware.fullCopyDescription: Creates a complete and independent copy of the disk
hardware.noNodeAvailable: No other node available in the cluster for migration.
hardware.vmWillStayActive: The VM will stay active during migration
hardware.linkedCloneDescription: Linked Clone: uses source disk as base (faster, less space)
hardware.cpuHostWarning: âš ï¸ VM uses cpu:host - Ensure CPUs are similar
hardware.cpuHostDifferentVendor: âŒ Different CPU vendors (Intel vs AMD) - Risky migration
hardware.cpuHostMigrationWarning: Migration with cpu:host may fail or cause instability
hardware.cpuHostMigrationTip: Tip: Change CPU type to x86-64-v2-AES for safe migration, or disable online migration.
hardware.cpuLevelTooHigh: CPU type {vmCpu} is not supported by this node (max: {targetMax})
hardware.cpuHostSimilar: âš ï¸ Similar but not identical CPUs - Check compatibility
hardware.cpuHostAllIdentical: All nodes have identical CPUs - Safe migration
hardware.cpuIncompatibleBlocked: Migration blocked: VM CPU is not compatible with this node

crossCluster.lxcNotSupportedDesc: Cross-cluster migration currently only works with QEMU/KVM virtual machines. For LXC containers, consider using backup/restore or manual migration.
crossCluster.haNotSupported: HA-managed VM cannot be migrated cross-cluster
crossCluster.haNotSupportedDesc: This VM is managed by High Availability (HA)
crossCluster.noConnectionsAvailable: No other clusters or standalone nodes configured. Add a connection in Settings to enable cross-cluster migration.
crossCluster.targetVmIdHelp: Leave empty to keep the same VMID
crossCluster.deleteSourceVmDesc: By default, the source VM is kept in a stopped state
crossCluster.liveMigrationDesc: VM will stay running during migration (minimal downtime)
crossCluster.vmStopped: VM is stopped - offline migration will be used
crossCluster.liveMigrationInfo: Live migration requires sufficient resources on the target node and network connectivity between clusters.
crossCluster.validationSuccess: All checks passed - ready to migrate

ldap.description: Configure LDAP/Active Directory authentication to allow users to sign in with their corporate credentials.
ldap.securityInfo: LDAP authentication is secure: credentials are verified directly by the orchestrator, never exposed to the browser.
ldap.enableLdapDesc: Users will be able to sign in with their LDAP/AD credentials
ldap.serverUrlHelper: Use ldaps:// for a secure connection (recommended)
ldap.bindDnHelper: Account used to search for users
ldap.bindPasswordKeep: Leave empty to keep current password
ldap.tlsInsecure: Ignore TLS certificate errors (not recommended in production)
ldap.userFilterHelper: Use {{username}} as placeholder for the entered username
ldap.emailAttributeHelper: LDAP attribute containing the email address
ldap.nameAttributeHelper: LDAP attribute containing the display name

drsPage.recommendationStale: This recommendation is no longer valid. The VM has been moved or is no longer on the expected source node.
drsPage.clustersEquilibrated: All clusters are balanced. No action needed.
drsPage.noNewRecommendation: No new recommendation. {count} migration(s) in progress.
drsPage.noNodeInMaintenance: No node in maintenance. All nodes are operational.
drsPage.noAffinityRulesDesc: Use Proxmox tags or create rules manually

drsPage.actionGuestsEvacuated: Existing guests can be evacuated manually or automatically
drsPage.actionAffinityRespected: Affinity rules will be respected if possible
drsPage.imbalanceThresholdDesc: Minimum standard deviation to trigger proactive balancing
drsPage.homogenizationEnabledDesc: Actively balances load across all nodes in the cluster

updates.rollingUpdateDescription: Rolling update allows you to update all cluster nodes without service interruption.
updates.strategyDescription: VMs will be automatically migrated to other nodes before update, then migrated back if necessary.

updates.noChangelogAvailable: No changelog available for this package.
updates.comingSoonDescription: Automatic rolling update execution will be available in a future version.
updates.allCanMigrate: All can be migrated (stopped or replication)

emptyState.noEventsDesc: No events have been recorded yet. Events will appear here when actions are performed on your infrastructure.
emptyState.noAlertsDesc: Everything looks good! No alerts have been triggered.
emptyState.noJobsDesc: No scheduled or running jobs found. Jobs will appear here when tasks are executed.
emptyState.noBackupsDesc: No backup data found. Backups will appear here once configured and executed.

emptyState.noConnectionsDesc: Add your first cluster connection to start monitoring your infrastructure.
emptyState.noDrsDesc: No Proxmox clusters with DRS support found. Connect a cluster with multiple nodes to use DRS.
emptyState.noStorageDesc: No storage volumes found. Storage will appear here once your clusters are connected.
